title: Executive Order 6266-Withdrawal of Public Lands for Resurvey, Colorado
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910 (ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497), and subject to the conditions, provisions, and limitations of said acts, it is hereby ordered that the public lands in T. 1 S., R. 84 W. of the sixth principal meridian, Colorado, be, and the same are hereby, withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, entry, and all forms of appropriation, pending a resurvey of said township under the act of March 3, 1909 (ch. 271, 35 Stat. 845).
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President or bv an act of Congress.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6266-Withdrawal of Public Lands for Resurvey, Colorado Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362090
